channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport
channel.description: The latest stories from the Sport section of the BBC Sport web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Injured Wilshere out for six weeks
item.description: Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere suffers a hairline fracture in his left foot and will be sidelined for at least six weeks.

item.title: Anelka gesture had 'anti-Semitic' link
item.description: Nicolas Anelka was banned because his 'quenelle' gesture had an "anti-Semitic" element, says an FA disciplinary panel.

item.title: England v Wales - a game for the ages
item.description: The passionate rivalry between England and Wales is a treasure trove of emotion passed down from generation to generation

item.title: Thursday's gossip column
item.description: Chelsea eye Van Persie, Spurs anxious to keep Lloris, Soldado vows to stay, plus more

item.title: Pistorius found praying over body
item.description: A neighbour of Oscar Pistorius tells his murder trial he found the South African Paralympic athlete praying over his girlfriend's body as she lay dying.

item.title: McLaren 'will win races this year'
item.description: Ron Dennis is convinced McLaren will win races this year, after he seized back control of Formula 1 operations in January.

item.title: Teenager Knight is GB Sochi flagbearer
Henderson comes into Ireland team
item.description: Ulster back-row forward Iain Henderson comes into the Ireland team for Saturday's Six Nations game with Italy in Dublin.

item.title: Roberts relishing England hype
item.description: Wales centre Jamie Roberts says he is relishing the hype surrounding Sunday's Six Nations match with England.

item.title: Wing May relishes Cuthbert reunion
item.description: England winger Jonny May is looking forward to lining up opposite old school friend Alex Cuthbert against Wales on Sunday.

item.title: Magath set for 'most difficult' test
item.description: Felix Magath says trying to keep Fulham in the Premier League is the toughest test of his managerial career.

item.title: Pursuit team 'lacked commitment'
item.description: The men's pursuit team lacked commitment in the lead up to the World Track Championships says British Cycling head coach Shane Sutton.

item.title: Watson sets up clash with Radwanska
item.description: Heather Watson faces world number three Agnieszka Radwanska in Indian Wells after beating Swiss Belinda Bencic.

item.title: Broad 'baffled' by ball change
item.description: Stuart Broad says he was "baffled" by a decision to change a ball in England's 25-run win over West Indies in the third ODI.

item.title: Buttler backed by legend Richards
item.description: West Indies legend Viv Richards says England one-day star Jos Buttler is "one of the finest finishers in world cricket".

item.title: Carney targets more England goals
item.description: Birmingham City's Karen Carney hopes to add to her England goal tally in Friday's Cyprus Cup tie with Finland.

item.title: Ecclestone plans for Azerbaijan race
item.description: A Formula 1 race could be held in Azerbaijan in 2015, according to chief executive Bernie Ecclestone.

item.title: Woods fit to play in WGC event
item.description: Tiger Woods is fit to play in the World Golf Championships at Doral despite withdrawing from the Honda Classic in Florida.

item.title: VIDEO: World Cup moments: Negrete's volley
item.description: BBC Sport counts down 100 of the greatest World Cup moments, as the 2014 tournament in Brazil draws nearer.

item.title: VIDEO: Hodgson ponders 'difficult' decisions
item.description: England manager Roy Hodgson says selecting his 23-man squad for the World Cup in Brazil will be "very difficult".

item.title: VIDEO: 1966 World Cup: Top 10 goals
item.description: BBC Sport picks its favourite goals from the 1966 World Cup, including Geoff Hurst's famous strike against West Germany to help England lift the trophy.

item.title: VIDEO: 2010 World Cup: Top 10 goals
item.description: BBC Sport picks its favourite goals from the 2010 World Cup finals in South Africa.

item.title: VIDEO: 2006 World Cup: Top 10 goals
item.description: BBC Sport picks its favourite goals from the 2006 World Cup in Germany.

item.title: VIDEO: World Cup moments: Crazy Maradona
item.description: BBC Sport counts down 100 of the greatest World Cup moments, as the 2014 tournament in Brazil draws nearer.

item.title: VIDEO: World Cup moments: Bergkamp stunner
item.description: BBC Sport counts down 100 of the greatest World Cup moments, as the 2014 tournament in Brazil draws nearer.

item.title: VIDEO: Who should Hodgson take to Brazil?
item.description: Football Focus presenter Dan Walker takes a closer look at Roy Hodgson's latest England squad alongside former Aston Villa striker John Carew and Martin Keown.

item.title: VIDEO: Memorable England World Cup goals
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at some of England's most memorable goals at past World Cup finals, after qualifying for Brazil 2014.

item.title: VIDEO: Brown scores screamer in Poland
item.description: Skipper Scott Brown slams in the winner for Scotland in Warsaw as Gordon Strachan's side beat Poland 1-0 in a friendly.

item.title: VIDEO: England players on 'positive' display
item.description: England players Daniel Sturridge, Gary Cahill and Jordan Henderson reflect on England's 1-0 win over Denmark.

item.title: VIDEO: England-Wales will be massive - Dawson
item.description: Matt Dawson says England's preparation for their match against Wales will all be about payback for last year's 30-3 drubbing.

item.title: VIDEO: Ball change 'baffles' Broad
item.description: Captain Stuart Broad denies that England tampered with the ball during their one-day international victory over the West Indies.

item.title: VIDEO: England Women beat Italy 2-0
item.description: England beat Italy 2-0 in their opening Cyprus Cup Group A game thanks to goals from Karen Carney and Toni Duggan.

item.title: VIDEO: Gerrard backs psychiatrist move
item.description: Steven Gerrard says psychiatrist Dr Steve Peters, who will work with England at the World Cup, has helped him achieve the most consistent form of his career.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Biggest fight in British history'
item.description: Boxing promoter Eddie Hearn believes the re-match between Carl Froch and George Groves will be the "biggest fight in British boxing history."

item.title: VIDEO: Cook critics deluded - Swann
item.description: Graeme Swann says anyone who questions whether Alistair Cook should remain as England captain is "deluded".

item.title: VIDEO: 'Race stopped me captaining England'
item.description: Former Arsenal and England defender Sol Campbell believes he could have captained England for 10 years if he had been white instead of black.

item.title: VIDEO: Formula 1's best overtakes of 2013
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at some of the most exciting overtaking manoeuvres from the 2013 Formula 1 season.

item.title: VIDEO: McGinley praises vice-captains' 'passion'
item.description: Ryder Cup captain Paul McGinley says he picked vice-captains Sam Torrance and Des Smyth because of their "ability, passion and judgement".

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights: Wales 30-3 England
item.description: Watch highlights as Wales thrash England 30-3 to clinch the Six Nations title at Millennium Stadium.

item.title: VIDEO: O'Neill disappointed with NI performance
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill is critical of his team's performance in the scoreless draw with Cyprus in Nicosia.

item.title: VIDEO: O'Sullivan hits 147 to win Welsh Open
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan hits a 147 break to defeat Ding Junhui 9-3 and win the 2014 Welsh Open title.

item.title: VIDEO: Can Man City keep up with Chelsea?
item.description: Mark Chapman is joined by Martin Keown and Mark Lawrenson for this week's Match of the Day 3, as they trio look back at the weekend's Premier League results.

item.title: VIDEO: Classic Wales v England clashes
item.description: Highlights of six of the best Six Nations games between England and Wales, including Wales' last-gasp win in 1999 and a peroxide blond Will Greenwood scoring a hat-trick in 2001.

item.title: VIDEO: James wins Keirin bronze at worlds
item.description: Becky James fails to defend her Keirin title finishing third in the final at the World track Cycling championships in Colombia.

item.title: VIDEO: Trott secures track cycling silver
item.description: Double Olympic champion Laura Trott wins her second medal at the World track Cycling Championships in Colombia with silver in the Omnium.

item.title: Who is on the England plane to Brazil?
item.description: After England beat Denmark, which players are off to the World Cup, who remains on the fringes and who is unlikely to feature?

item.title: A lot of people want me to fail - Tomkins
item.description: Super League's poster boy Sam Tomkins aims to prove his critics wrong as he prepares to make his debut in the NRL

item.title: Seven British medal hopes for World Indoors
item.description: "Britain's young athletes will have to learn to deal with expectation and not buckle under the spotlight," says Steve Cram

item.title: Sure-footed McGinley well equipped for Ryder Cup
item.description: Europe captain Paul McGinley's decisions continue to send out the right messages ahead of Gleneagles, writes Iain Carter

item.title: Scotland need ambition and pace - Blair
item.description: Scotland can upset France if they get the visitors running on the heavy Murrayfield pitch, says ex-scrum-half Mike Blair

item.title: Strachan's Scotland impress again
item.description: A third consecutive win on the road bodes well for Scotland's Euro 2016 campaign, writes BBC Sport's Alasdair Lamont

item.title: Sochi Paralympics: Ones to watch
item.description: The Sochi Paralympics get under way on 7 March, and BBC Sport picks out the athletes to watch on the snow and ice

item.title: Must-not-miss sport on the BBC
item.description: Your guide to the latest sporting events on the BBC, including athletics, Six Nations and top-flight football

item.title: Defender gets 28-game ban for tackle
item.description: Vietnam international Tran Dinh Dong is banned for 28 matches after breaking an opponent's leg during a league game.

item.title: Stars record England World Cup song
item.description: Gary Barlow and Gary Lineker lead a team of football and pop stars to record the video for the official England 2014 World Cup song.

item.title: Farah to run at Glasgow Grand Prix
item.description: Double Olympic champion Mo Farah will compete at Glasgow's Diamond League meeting on 11-12 July.

item.title: Wembley to host Froch-Groves rematch
item.description: Carl Froch and George Groves' rematch will take place at Wembley Stadium on 31 May, promoter Eddie Hearn announces.

item.title: England hold on for series victory
item.description: Joe Root scores his first one-day international ton as England beat West Indies by 25 runs to win the series 2-1.

item.title: Brailsford free of blame - Sutton
item.description: Head coach Shane Sutton says Sir Dave Brailsford is not to blame for Britain's poor World Track Cycling display in Colombia.

item.title: Ukraine Paralympians 'may boycott'
item.description: Ukrainian Paralympians may boycott the Sochi Games and fear for their country, says their Paralympic Committee president.

item.title: Shaw cherishes 'dream' England debut
item.description: Southampton defender Luke Shaw hopes he has improved his chances of making the World Cup after a 'dream' England debut.

item.title: Williams relief ahead of new F1 season
item.description: Williams admit they are "relieved" that they appear to have a competitive car for the 2014 Formula 1 season.

item.title: McIlroy loses in Florida play-off
item.description: Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy lost in a four-way play-off at the Honda Classic in Florida to American Russell Henley.

item.title: Fenton Cheltenham entries clear to run
item.description: Philip Fenton's three Cheltenham Festival entries, including Gold Cup hope Last Instalment, pass dope tests.

item.title: Lorenzo dominates Phillip Island test
item.description: Yamaha's Jorge Lorenzo finishes clear of Honda's Dani Pedrosa in the tyre safety testing session on Phillip Island.

item.title: Russia on top as 2014 Games end
item.description: Hosts Russia finish top of the medal table and Britain equals its best performance as Sochi 2014 comes to an end.

item.title: Burgess 'focused' before Bath switch
item.description: Sam Burgess wants NRL success with South Sydney before switching codes to join Bath, says Rabbitohs coach Michael Maguire.

item.title: Italy's Parisse out of Ireland game
item.description: Italy captain and number eight Sergio Parisse has a slight calf strain and misses the Six Nations match against Ireland.

item.title: O'Sullivan 147 seals Welsh Open win
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan makes a 147 break in the final frame to wrap up a 9-3 victory over Ding Junhui in the Welsh Open final.

item.title: GB men fail to qualify for Euros
item.description: Great Britain's men's water polo team fail to qualify for the 2014 European Championship after a play-off defeat by Romania.

item.title: Hutchins named director at Queen's
item.description: British tennis player Ross Hutchins is named tournament director for the Aegon Championships at Queen's Club.

item.title: Briton pulls out of 'scary' downhill
item.description: Former British soldier Mick Brennan will not compete in Saturday's downhill at the Winter Paralympics after describing conditions as "scary".

item.title: QPR announce £65m loss for 2013
item.description: Championship side QPR announce a loss of over £65m in their accounts to May 2013 and an overall debt of £177.1m

item.title: Celtic striker charged with assault
item.description: Celtic striker and Republic of Ireland international Anthony Stokes is questioned by police about an alleged assault on an Elvis impersonator.

item.title: Coleman hails Bale's signature show
item.description: Wales boss Chris Coleman jokes he nearly asked Gareth Bale for his autograph after he starred in a 3-1 win over Iceland.

item.title: Glens under-strength for Ballymena
item.description: Glentoran have a number of players suspended and injury concerns for the visit of Ballymena United to the Oval on Friday night.
